poem:
Title: "The Silent Voice of the Overlooked"

A minister's role faded with dawn's light,
In halls of power, out of sight.
Chaired presences shift in careless way,
Lifting voice for the voiceless, who may say?
Votes, vengeful as winter winds, may call,
To teach pride precedes a fall.
In mighty discourse, remember small,
Or integrity of power shall pall.
